intro: Michelia reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate michelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Magnoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly rough texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
